content.title: Amputation Decision in ALI
content.description: When to proceed directly to amputation rather than revascularization

key_concepts.details: Rutherford III: profound sensory loss, muscle paralysis, no arterial or venous Doppler signals
Mangled Extremity Severity Score >7 predictive of amputation
Rigor, mottling that doesn't blanch, anesthesia, muscle necrosis
Comorbidities, functional status, patient preferences influence decision

content.clinical_significance: Revascularization of irreversibly ischemic limb risks fatal reperfusion injury
